notes: Attempted to reproduce concurrent SKBitmap.Decode AccessViolationException on macOS ARM64 with .NET 8. Ran 3 stress tests (byte array decode, stream decode, SKCodec path) with 100 threads x 200 iterations each (60,000 concurrent decodes per version) across SkiaSharp 2.88.9, 3.119.2, and main (source). All 180,000+ decodes completed with zero errors. The original issue was reported on Windows IIS with .NET Framework 4.x in 2016, and subsequent reports span .NET Core through .NET 7 on Windows. The bug may be platform-specific (Windows), specific to older Skia native library versions, or related to .NET Framework GC/marshaling behavior that differs from modern .NET on macOS.

blockers: Original issue reported on Windows IIS with .NET Framework 4.x — current environment is macOS ARM64 with .NET 8, which may have different threading/GC/native interop behavior
AccessViolationException terminates the .NET process and cannot be caught — if a subtle race condition exists, it may require many more iterations or specific timing conditions to trigger on macOS
Multiple reporters confirmed the crash on Windows (.NET Framework 4.x, .NET Core 2.x, .NET 5, .NET 7) but none on macOS — this may be a Windows-specific native code issue
